items.description: categories relevant to the designed experience

items.$comment: @todo: determine file/code management for .css, .js, .html, etc. for experience.

manifest.description: Special case object: Produced by `Avatar` in experience mode [can be requested at any time, but provided in initial experience push] used for front-end display and tracking in `XP-bar`. Essentially exists as an independent short-form of a given experience. No cast is built nor provided, that would be a separate request.

mbr_id.$comment: partition-key for primary member author: sysName|core_id

name.$comment: name of the experience is only displayed in

items.description: Scenes are the major stepwise timeline of events in the experience; they could be considered acts or phases also. Of course can expand. Unclear if scenes can be events in scenes. If so, nesting limit?

scenes.$comment: artificial cap of 6 scenes for alpha, keeps trudge down.

skippable.description: if the experience is skippable, only system experiences could be non-skippable. If skippable, then the experience can be skipped by the experiencer.

show-playbill.description: show the cast by default in the experience

bot_id.$comment: only creator bots have bot_id, Q, etc left blank

name.description: name of the cast member in the experience.

role.description: named role of the cast member in the experience.
role.$comment: if not specified, then the role is the name of the cast member.

type.description: Type of cast member. Defaults to MyLife. if `member` or `member-bot` then implies member engagement.
type.$comment: Defaults to system explanation or engagement with experiencer.

animation.description: animation of the event, object of animation depends on action, cast member and event itself

backdrop.description: MyLife interface backdrop for the event, default inherits from scene

cast-member-id.description: id of the cast member referenced in this action
cast-member-id.$comment: current limitation: only one actor per event, no duets!

effect.description: effect of the event, default inherits from scene

order.description: order of the event in the scene, if same integer then order is linear.

action.description: action when the hook is triggered, default is chat.

order.description: order of the hook, if same hook identified multiple times.

experience-lived.description: Special case object: Represents the actual 'lived' experience, stored on member-basis, tracks progress inside of a specific experience, ergo is not required [nor do we currently] to save the entire experience in the member's record, but the 'conversation' for now of the experience. **note**: conversation will contain the thread information; one thread per member experience-lived.
experience-lived.name: Experience-Lived

version.description: version of the lived experience as provided by developers; ergo, context not lost so long as versions are saved and solid (unmutated).

experience-manifest.description: Special case object: Produced by `Avatar` in experience mode [can be requested at any time, but provided in initial experience push] used for front-end display and tracking in `XP-bar`. Essentially exists as an independent short-form of a given experience. No cast is built nor provided, that would be a separate request.
experience-manifest.name: Experience-Manifest

scenes.description: Scenes are the major stepwise timeline of events in the experience; they could be considered acts or phases also. Of course can expand.

items.description: Scene of the experience, in shortest form, i.e., required fields only.

experience-manifest-event.description: Event of the experience for `XP-bar` display , in shortest form, i.e., required fields only.
experience-manifest-event.name: Experience-Manifest-Event

description.description: description of the event for member experiencing, presume `:hover` action or '?'.

experience-manifest-scene.description: Scene of the experience for `XP-bar` display , in shortest form, i.e., required fields only.
experience-manifest-scene.name: Experience-Manifest-Scene

description.description: description of the scene for member experiencing, presume `:hover` action or '?'.

events.description: Smallest form of events in the scene, for `XP-bar` display.

items.description: Event of the experience for `XP-bar` display , in shortest form, i.e., required fields only.

id.$comment: fronte-end notes: to be used as dom ID characteristics to be referenced in any css.

order.description: order of the scene in the experience, if same integer then order is linear.
order.$comment: display notes: can imagine in tree form being displayed as 1.1 and 1.2 as sub-nodes that share the same core scene number.

backdrop.description: MyLife interface backdrop for the scene.
backdrop.$comment: event-level backdrop override, if any. Default is chat.

description.description: description of the scene for member experiencing.

order.description: order of the scene in the experience, if same integer then order is linear.

items.description: placeholder for any tools available in the scene
